variant.question: According to the relevant FCL requirements, the successful completion of multi-crew co-operation (MCC) training in helicopters is one of the conditions required for...

options.text: any revalidation of a rating on a multi-pilot helicopter.
a professional pilot licence.
a first class rating on multi-engine helicopters.
a first type rating on multi-pilot helicopters.

variant.question: How is "Solo flight time" defined in Part FCL?

options.text: That time when the pilot is acting in command of the aircraft.
Flight time during which the student pilot is the sole manipulator of the flight controls from start-up to shut-down.
The student acting a pilot in command on a flight when the instructor is just observing.
Flight time during which a student pilot is the sole occupant of an aircraft.
A categorisation of aircraft according to specified basic characteristics, for example aeroplane, powered-lift, helicopter, airship, sailplane, free balloon.
A categorisation of aircraft based upon performance, in terms of maximum operating speed and altitude.
A categorisation of aircraft according to defined maximum all up mass in the take off configuration.
A categorisation of single pilot aeroplanes not requiring a type rating.

variant.question: The flying training for an applicant of a CPL(A) integrated course shall comprise..

options.text: a total of at least 200 flying hours, instrument ground time not provided.
a total of at least 150 flying hours, instrument ground time not provided.
a total of at least 200 flying hours, of which up to 10 hours for the entire course may be instrument ground time.
a total of at least 150 flying hours, of which up to 5 hours for the entire course may be instrument ground time.

variant.question: Who can revalidate and renew Class 1 and 2 medical certificates?

options.text: Aero Medical Centre (AeMC), Aero Medical Examiner (AME) and General Medical Practitioners (GMP)
Aero Medical Centre (AeMC) and Aero Medical Evaluator (AME)
Aero Medical Centre (AeMC)
General Medical Practitioners (GMP)
